name: heeeraldo
text: how long can this 5-train go for? It's #2 over here...

name: dr_manflesh_desires_anal_play_immediately
text: http://mirrors.hiddenfrontier.com/download.php/101Act1.mov

name: andrew_
text: Good choice, Chris Onstad.

name: morelaak
text:
number six, carrying the torch.

also, there is nothing quite as satisfying for a basketball player as seeing that point go up on the board once he puts the other player's body in his van.

name: morelaak
text: also, in the alt text: taut is not a word i feel comfortable with. i don't know why, i just don't.

name: doc_rostov
text:
Yeah. Same vibe here. Sort of like how Congress feels about ghost bikes, I'm guessin'. Don't feel mighty comfortable having Casper all ridin' willy nilly cross the street in a beat up ghost Harley. Danger to the children. Just like Taut, the linguistic equivalent of illegal ghost bikes.

PS: Whoever broke the 5 chain is a straight up douche.

name: buttermoths
text:
I guess whoever did it gave it a lower score because it's a rerun, not because it's not 5-worthy. Not that it was me, you guys! Whoa.

Also, it's nice to see such as a director's commentary in the alt-text, hope he keeps doing that with forthcoming reruns.

name: parsifal
text:
It took me a while to realize that you guys were all rooting for a perfect 5 on this strip.

Maybe instead, you could all lobby to have a sixth rating put into place that was alternately a steaming erection or a sweaty, dripping vagina.

name: soticoto
text: In case anyone missed a comment I made many moons ago on a far earlier rerun... I always give 1 s to reruns. Always .

name: decagon
text:
That word gives me pretty serious heebies/jeebies and I'm glad to discover I'm not the only one.

In my case, I think it derives from hearing the skin on someone's wrist described as taut. Like it's unnaturally stretched as far as it will go, and if you stretch it any more it will tear open and blood will fall out, or something to that effect.

name: spicyponyhead
text: I think "taut" might be the new "moist". I will add it to the list of words that I am strangely creeped out by, for no apparent reason. See also: scuttle, pudding.

name: parsifal
text: Dear diary, today spicyponyhead finally revealed to me...

name: ford
text: I am completely creeped out by the word "seabiscuit," I'm not sure why.

name: juanclaudius
text:
number 8 represent
the 5s gotta keep up this time

name: sittered
text: I would be sinning in thought against Pete if I didn't rate this a five (number 12).

name: baseballfan
text: A comment left by baseballfan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by carazuri, mysterymeat1001, ezcmac, Contrasoma, VandenBos, tekende, ButterMoths, jrpigman, pmoney187, morelaak, Dezufnocosem, Overmedicated, layzerblade, memnoch, Soy, puadxe, envika, schadenfreude87, decagon, astro_zombie, wae, sirptom, flazisismuss, kazad, grayestnova, heath, LordHumungus, songbirdspectre, Agrajag, DESTROY_YOU, solobuttons, Moraiat, Khabuem, catgrl131, thesyndicate88, joshuah, Paco, Baryonyx, Prine, juanclaudius, BlueLoggy, Phy, coldfrog, Fcannon, Tragic_Johnson, nutmeg, dzieger, kenyot, Hexjumper, UConnHusky, jlowe424, mrblank91, mendenbar, smilebuddha, retinarow, Doc_Rostov, ford, lastlarf, Panserbjorne, Ubermensch, Dallovich, Budenhagen)

name: morelaak
text:
wow, i don't know what deserves a lame more, the fact that you posted this, or the fact that you actually followed through.

thanks for being a dick, dick.

P.S.: dick.

name: moraiat
text:
Threats: lame
Calling people a dick: chubby
all clear? aaand break!

name: songbirdspectre
text: yep. he's a dick.

name: coldfrog
text: I set my lame comment skipping count at 25 because I thought that none would ever reach such a fantastic threshold.  Congratulations, my friend.  You have just forced me to set my standards higher.

name: straw
text: Or lower, as it were.

name: ford
text: Anyone who uses the phrase "as it were" correctly automatically get a chubby from me.

name: tekende
text: Is there a common incorrect usage of the phrase?

name: ford
text: No, it's just that no one ever uses it withing earshot of me, and I use it all the time.

name: atticusonline
text: I've never heard of one, as it were.

name: flazisismuss
text: Should there be a new word meaning the act of trolling for lames?  If there isn't one now I wonder what we should use for this unfilled etymological niche.

name: tekende
text: Orc?

name: mysterymeat1001
text: I've seen worse.

name: envika
text: at 93 lames, this is the record, and deservedly so .

name: wittyname
text: What comic was he making that comment on?

name: envika
text: this one . i knew the question would arise

name: budenhagen
text:
Well, it's at 101 now... my lameit (IT'S A PUN) was set to 99... I never thought I'd see it broken.

Also, this strip is the raddest. Forever.

name: envika
text: what's worse is that four people so far have actually chubbied this guy. says a lot, doesn't it?

name: earendil
text: i don't know, that made me laugh.

name: earendil
text: not that i'm going to chubby it tho.  on principle.

name: falseprophet
text: Assetbar does not negotiate with terrorists.

name: saint
text:
coerced into chubbies?
not a chance in frozen hell, ass wad.

name: prine
text: New game: let's see how many lames this dude can get

name: sirptom
text: I'm down for that.  Aaand... LAMED.

name: buttermoths
text:
I am there
baseballfan is there
It's just the 13 of us
I give baseballfan a lame
And I am the winner

name: wae
text: No status, no class indeed.

name: biff
text:
The worst part about this to me is the way her assholery impugns all baseball fans.

Of course, I also think the blackmail part is pretty bad too. It's just that for me, baseball is sacred and holy and shouldn't be associated with such reprehensible behavior.

name: paco
text: A comment left by paco was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Lonis, earendil, mattylite, biff)

name: ford
text:
I lamed this guy, but i almost want to go through and make this exact post on every strip, see if i can get more lames than anyone else.

There should be leaderboards.

name: kenyot
text: After reading this strip, I knew I would always be in love with Achewood. I also knew what it's like to kill someone.

name: retinarow
text: After reading this strip, I finally knew how to play basketball.

name: bryc_e
text: That is some taut prose. Tauter than a pressed Hemingway sandwich.

name: morelaak
text:
whew. that's taut.

and again, i'm not too sure i'm okay with that....

name: falseprophet
text: Tauter than Alice Walker's color purple.

name: abc_heidi
text: The strip that really sold me on Achewood. It was the zoom in from the 5th to the 7th panel and the cut off shot of the van and I just thought "genius".

name: destroy_you
text:
Why do Nice Pete's eyes look like two black holes from which there is no escape from in the second panel?

Also, I expected his score to be a little higher then one.

name: destroy_you
text: Curse the lack of edit features.

name: wittyname
text: Well, that seems like the most apt description of Nice Pete's eyes ever.

name: vandenbos
text: The game ends at one.  Come on.

name: fablesandblues
text: Nice Pete wears a tube socks and a tank top during a murder and nothing else.

name: thesyndicate88
text: According to the shot clock, it only takes Nice Pete twenty seconds to commit a murder. Now that's skill.

name: fankjankler
text: Murdering the other player is the only known way to get exactly one point in basketball.

name: dallovich
text: What if you just score on a penalty shot? :<

name: stop
text: Killing comes so easily to Nice Pete, it is basically a free throw.

name: chuchurocket
text: i suppose murder is probably the ultimate penalty.

name: jlynes
text:
I thought it was a four-point play.

Plus a simultaneous flagrant foul.

name: dezufnocosem
text: "Before they used a shot clock in basketball, Illinois's Georgetown high demonstrated why the game needed one. After scoring a free throw early in the first half, the Georgetown team stole the ball from their Homer High opponents, then stalled for the rest of the game. Unable to break the freeze the Homer players eventually sat down on the court, while the referee read the newspaper. When time ran out, Georgetown celebrated their 1-0 victory--a typical score for a soccer game but the lowest score in the history of basketball."  -The Big Book of DUH!

name: flazisismuss
text: Chubby for the research.  Why didn't Homer High just foul whoever had the ball?  Alternatively, they could have just killed the opposing side.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: would that not have given them a score higher than one?

name: tekende
text: No. Free throws are only worth one point.

name: retinarow
text: then they would be the winners.

name: spectre
text: I would have killed the no-account REF.

name: tekende
text: I don't even like sports, but this amuses me to no end.

name: falseprophet
text: I know Nice Pete is a cat, but this reissue makes his pantslessness much more pronounced.

name: nictusempra
text: I still find reissues in a well-archived webcomic to be a strange premise at best, but this -is- a lovely strip.

name: lacrimus
text: I love how Nice Pete is the visiting team to someone he is murdering.

name: featurelessvoid
text: What's rough is that it was his opponent's homecoming game.  To ensure an easy win in front of the home crowd, they invited what they thought was an opponent of low mind.  Little did they know.

name: weekendofsound
text: I don't get this reissue shit. why can't he slap something together that explains what happens to sprinkles the dog, or is presented by Roomba!?

name: adhesion
text: Sprinkles? Surely you mean Scrambles. He hasn't been around because he's lost.

name: weekendofsound
text: well I need some closure, okay?

name: featurelessvoid
text: Scrambles?  Oh, we didn't have the heart to tell you this, but he got rabies and AIDS from eating a dirty squirrel.  He died thirsty.  It was the saddest thing.

name: sammybeany
text:
Because he is not a monkey dressed up in a tuxedo here to dance for your entertainment.

Well, I mean, I guess he is . . . but monkeys have families and need breaks as well. Don't be selfish.

name: phy
text: So, um, what happens when the shot clock runs out?

name: qingofchina
text: Naked again...

name: supertrackxc
text: Hugggsss!!!!

name: avestriel
text: I want a reissue of Mickey Mouse Pancake. Or was it an omelette?

name: zedpower
text: It was a crêpe au cauchemar .

name: earendil
text: chubbied for alliteration in a foreign language.

name: zedpower
text:
I... I gotta come clean on this.

I'm French-Canadian. To me, it's no foreign language at all. Plus the alliteration was wholly accidental.

Man, that's a load off!

name: gerry
text: This has always been one of my favorites, but I think when it comes to Nice Pete, I like the "killin' is a special thing" comic better.

name: grayestnova
text: I've always liked this one, but I've never been entirely sure as to why Nice Pete is not wearing pants.

name: flash1087
text: That's always bothered me, too. Does he only kill pantslessly? WHAT IS THE AUTHOR IMPLYING?

name: featurelessvoid
text: I think it's because he's a cat.

name: flash1087
text: Oh, silly me.

name: grayestnova
text: well, yes, but Nice Pete seems to be the sort of cat that is panted most of the time.

name: evolume
text: Something happens between panel 7 and 8. This thing is best left unsaid.

name: flash1087
text:
There's actually something vaguely deep about this one. Pete doesn't at all detail the step where he actually kills the other player, just the moments beforehand and the point where he's putting their body in his van. Does he just choose not to remember the part where he COMMITS the murder?

Also, does his hair always look like that from behind? I need to re-read Mr. Band, see if that shows it. It almost looks like Onstad wanted to give him some kickin' 70's basketball hair, but it's close enough that it may look like that anyway.

name: da_newb
text: Haha. I love the last two panels.

name: kb
text:
I HAVE READ THIS STRIP A BILLION TIMES!
I JUST NOW NOTICED NICE PETE IS NAKED FROM THE WAIST DOWN WHILE PLAYING BASKETBALL!
WHAT THE FUCK!

name: noah
text: See the alt text here . Tube socks and a tank top, dude.

name: tragicone
text: I showed this one to a friend. He died laughing two weeks later...

name: theoneyouwant
text: nice pete is not wearing shorts.

name: dutch
text: this strip deserves a 5 just because of nice pete's great ass

name: spectre
text: Yeah, before you die, you see . . . Nice Pete.

name: dasilodavi
text: This is one of my favorites as well.  My friends think I'm disturbed.  I'm not saying they're wrong, but seriously, this is funny.

name: sparhawk
text: Nice Pete's blog, incidentally, is one of Satan's less contestable works.

name: tekende
text: The alt text could also be used to describe Nice Pete's bottom.

name: ham_shoes
text: I like it when the strips are open-ended like this one.  Makes you think
